content.question: A regular hexagon of uniform density is initially at rest and free to rotate about an axis at its center. Three forces, <math alttext="F sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="F sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="F sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>C</mi></msub></math>, have equal magnitude and are able to be applied in the direction and at the point shown in the figure. Which of these forces, if applied individually and for the same time interval, will produce the greatest increase in the hexagon’s angular speed?

choices.label: All three forces produce the same change in the hexagon’s angular speed.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
